page.title: 02The M25 in Chalfont St.Peter
page.content: {The Motorway} The M25 in our vicinity runs mainly through open farmland,with minimal housing nearby.Around 2380 vehicles passed through on the motorway on Saturday 4th May 1985 from 11-12:00, but this number will rise considerably after it is fully completed. {Noise} There has been much controversy over the motorway;the main constituent being noise.There could be 3 main ways of combatting noise.They are:to change the concrete surface to tarmac,plant trees,or build an earth barrier. {Attitudes} The majority of residents generally accept the noise as,"In the background,"but still believe in resurfacing.Generally,they like the motorway,although only 24%(12/50)use it on a regular basis. {Pollution} Pollution should not increase much,as the traffic now using the M25 previously used the A413.
